item.title: Alerting using SIEM Detections and ElastAlert2
item.author: Author
item.description: ElasticSearch SIEM Detections and Alerts and Actions are quite useful features, except for the fact that actual alerting is behind a license paywall. So while both of these features can run rules, check for conditions, and record the results in an index, neither of them actually provide alerting support. Alerting requires a Gold License, which if alerting is the only thing you want, is an excessive cost. If you can’t move off ElasticSearch to OpenSearch, which has Alerting available for free, you can use tools such as ElastAlert21 to handle the Alerting requirements.
